election_record.label: Massachusetts 1792 House of Representatives, Boston, Special

overview.note: "At a meeting of the freeholders and Other Inhabitants of the Town of Boston .... Assembled at Faneuil Hall, On Wednesday the 6th of June. Anno Domini 1792 10 O'Clock AM .... The Town having by Vote Determined to Choose Two Persons to Represent them in the General Court in the room of the Honorable Thomas Dawes and Benjamin Austin, Jr. Esq. who are Elected to a Seat in the Honarable Senate, .... The number of the same was found to be Two Hundred and Thirety Nine and upon sorting them it appeared the follwing Gentlemen had Obtained a Majority of the Votes Viz." Boston Town Records. 300.
